## Sampling from the copula



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim <- c(30, 20)
rho <- c(0.7, 0.9)
nu <- 2
n_obs <- 10
mu <- 6
sigma <- 2
xi <- 0.1

Z <- rmatern_copula(n_obs, dim, rho, nu)
U <- pnorm(Z)
Y <- qgev(U, loc = mu, scale = sigma, shape = xi)
```
:::

::: {.cell .column-page}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
tibble(
  Z = Z[, 1],
  U = U[, 1],
  Y = Y[, 1]
) |> 
  mutate(
    x = rep(seq_len(dim[1]), each = dim[2]),
    y = rep(seq_len(dim[2]), times = dim[1])
  ) |> 
  pivot_longer(c(Z, U, Y)) |> 
  mutate(
    name = fct_relevel(name, "Z", "U", "Y"),
    name2 = fct_recode(
      name,
      "Gaussian" = "Z",
      "Uniform" = "U",
      "GEV" = "Y"
    )
  ) |> 
  group_by(name) |> 
  group_map(
    \(data, ...) {
      data |> 
        ggplot(aes(x, y, fill = value)) +
        geom_raster() +
        scale_fill_viridis_c() +
        coord_cartesian(expand = FALSE) +
        theme(
          legend.position = "none"
        ) +
        labs(
          x = NULL,
          y = NULL,
          subtitle = unique(data$name2)
        )
    }
  ) |> 
  wrap_plots(ncol = 3) +
  plot_annotation(
    title = "Sampling from the Gaussian Copula",
    subtitle = "Going from Gaussian to Uniform to GEV"
  )
```

# Modeling



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
folded <- cmdstanr::cmdstan_model(
  here::here("casestudy", "Stan", "folded.stan"),
  include_paths = here::here("stanfunctions"),
  quiet = TRUE
)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
stan_data <- list(
  dim1 = dim[1],
  dim2 = dim[2],
  nu = nu,
  n_obs = n_obs,
  y = Y
)

gev_fit <- evd::fgev(Y)$estimate
inits <- list(
  mu = gev_fit[1],
  sigma = gev_fit[2],
  xi = pmax(gev_fit[3], 0),
  rho = c(0.5, 0.5)
)


results <- folded$sample(
  data = stan_data,
  chains = 4,
  parallel_chains = 4,
  init = list(inits, inits, inits, inits)
)
```
